wikipedia_page.main: James "Jamie" Rudolph Palumbo, Baron Palumbo of Southwark (born 6 June 1963) is a British entrepreneur and member of the House of Lords.

link_mentions.page: List of barons in the peerages of Britain and Ireland
List of Old Etonians born in the 20th century
response: *James Palumbo (born 1963), club owner, founder of the Ministry of Sound
James Palumbo is the co-founder and former chairman and CEO of the Group. He handed over the day-to-day running of the business to Lohan Presencer in 2008. In 2018, Presencer became chairman.

Berkmann was introduced to James Palumbo, who was working in property finance at the time, by Humphrey Waterhouse to realise the concept. The site, a disused bus garage, is located in Elephant & Castle in Southwark, London. The club opened on 21 September 1991 and has remained in this location since. Having considered "a load of daft names" for the club, including Get Off My Foot and The Ghost and Mrs Chicken, Berkmann came up with Ministry of Sound after walking past the Ministry of Defence Main Building.

Palumbo married Denia Wigram (the daughter of Lionel WigramBurke's Peerage 107th Edition, Page 3191) in 1959 – together they had one son (James Palumbo), and two daughters.  They divorced in 1977.  After Denia died in 1986, he married Hayat Mrowa (daughter of the Lebanese newspaper publisher Kamel Mrowa, and ex-wife of businessman Ely Calil) with whom he had another son and two daughters.
